name: AstroCamp 2.0 🌌 | Overnight Stay
description: 🌌 Experience the Universe Like Never Before! 🌠We are back with Astrocamp 2.0 for you to step into the Cosmos with us! 🔭Ready for a night where the universe feels just a touch away?Escape the city lights and immerse yourself in a night of celestial wonder at our Overnight Astro Camp, just a 2-hour drive from Bangalore. Experience breathtaking views of the night sky as you observe planets, galaxies, and constellations through powerful telescopes. Engage in guided stargazing sessions and cosmic storytelling, all set in a serene natural landscape. Whether you're an astronomy enthusiast or just looking for a magical night under the stars, this is an experience you won’t want to miss! ✨Your Experience Includes:•	A Private Cottage in the lap of Nature (2 person sharing, extra mattress available if required)•	Evening High Tea, Dinner, and Breakfast to fuel your cosmic adventure•	A Magical Journey across Galaxies — No passport required!📅 Date: Check in: 26th April (04:00 PM IST) Check Out: 27th April (11:00 AM IST)📍 Location: Atmaveda Shivasamudra (https://maps.app.goo.gl/mxvzyAF25Pe7mb9N9)⏳ Limited Spots Only! Book now and travel beyond our world! 🚀✨Cancellation PolicyOnce the payment is made, your spot is confirmed, and you have committed to attending the event. As participation is limited to only 30 individuals, cancellations can be challenging since all necessary arrangements, including accommodations, meals, and logistics, are planned in advance.We understand that unforeseen circumstances may arise, making it difficult for you to attend. While refunds are not available, your entry is transferable. If you are unable to join, you may transfer your booking to someone else by informing the organizers in advance.DisclaimerAstro Camp is a weather-dependent experience, and clear skies are essential for optimal stargazing and astronomical observations. While we will do our best to provide an enriching experience, certain celestial events, planetary viewings, and deep-sky observations may be affected by cloud cover, rain, or other unforeseen weather conditions.In case of unfavorable weather, alternative activities such as interactive astronomy discussions, short documentaries, astrophotography techniques, and telescope handling sessions will be conducted to ensure a fulfilling experience. However, no refunds will be issued due to weather-related disruptions.We appreciate your understanding and look forward to an incredible stargazing experience with you!

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

name: If backpacks could talk: where travel meets story
description: Something magical happens when you put travelers in a room. Join a gathering of people who’ve travelled, wondered, and returned with something to share. ✈️🧳🚂🚌This is a space for travel stories. You’re encouraged to bring a cherished souvenir from one of your travels. Expect the atmosphere of that hostel living room you’ve never forgotten. ✨Bring a story if you’d like or simply come curious. You might leave with a new perspective, a shared laugh, or even an itinerary inspired by someone else’s journey. :)About the facilitatorNitya is a slow, solo traveler who’s spent months at a time backpacking through Europe, Southeast and Central Asia with no fixed plans. She’s lived out of hostels, taken long detours, and found meaning in volunteering along the way. Her journeys are guided more by conversations than checklists. To her, travel is about finding the shared essence in the unfamiliar and returning with a deeper connection to the familiar.About the venueDialogues Cafe, Koramangala is known for creating spaces that enable meaningful conversations and a seamless experience. With several events hosted regularly, you’ll have no trouble being guided to the beautiful glass house on the rooftop, where our gathering will take place. See you there! 🙂

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

location.address: BLOCK-10, PRESTIGE NOTTING HILL, Bannerghatta Rd, Kalena Agrahara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560076, India

organizer.name: TheBohraThaal
organizer.description: The Bohra Thaal offers a unique home dining experience, bringing the rich traditions of Bohra cuisine to your table. Dine the authentic way—sharing a giant Thaal, savoring a curated 9-course feast, and connecting over food in a warm, welcoming home. Come as strangers, leave as friends!

name: Human Library Bengaluru
description: Each chapter of the Human Library is a guided space for meaningful non-judgmental conversations structured by thoughtful prompts. These prompts allow attendees to explore different perspectives stories and memories.Note: This is not a dating event.You can choose to listen to others` stories and share your own when you feel comfortable. Every participant takes turns sharing a memory opinion or experience related to the prompt assigned to them.Structure of the event:1. Introduction of attendees and the host.2. Attendees are divided into smaller groups.4. Each group receives a bowl of prompts.5. Prompts are divided into three levels: Level 1 Level 2 and Level 3.6. Level 1 prompts help people get to know each other.Example: What is your earliest childhood memory?7. Level 2 prompts encourage deeper conversations.Example: What is one habit from your lifestyle that you would recommend to others?8. Once Level 1 and Level 2 conversations are completed the smaller groups are merged for Level 3 prompts.9. Depending on the number of attendees either one or two larger groups are formed for Level 3 conversations.Come. Join. Share your stories or listen to othersCheck out our past events on our : @HumanlibrarybengaluruFor more details reach out to: +91 8867945246

location.address: 25, Lavelle Road, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

name: Aperitivo Italiano - Cicchetti e Vino in Bengaluru
description: Bengaluru, Sip & Savour Italy – One Glass at a TimeStep into a slice of Italy in the heart of Bengaluru! Aperitivo Italiano, part of IICCI’s Project Il Dolce Vino, invites you to an evening of exquisite wines, gourmet Italian delicacies, and expert-led tastings at the iconic Italia – The Park.Meet fellow wine lovers, connect with Indo-Italian business and lifestyle enthusiasts, and enjoy a vibrant cultural experience over glasses of fine Italian wine.🔹 Join us for an evening of La Dolce Vita – Bengaluru style!Note: Only one booking per person is allowed.

location.address: The Park, 14/7 14 7, Mahatma Gandhi Rd, Yellappa Garden, Yellappa Chetty Layout, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

organizer.name: Il Dolce Vino
organizer.description: Il Dolce Vino, by IICCI, promotes authentic Italian food and wine in India. It supports Italian exports via exclusive Wine Clubs in key cities, offering events, awareness programs, curated wine tours, and expert-led training, uniting the Indo-Italian food and wine community.

name: Girl Talk Chronicles: Talk Tresses
description: *Only for Women* 🌸Where real talk meets hair talk—and everything in between.💇‍♀️Welcome to Girl Talk Chronicles: Talk Tresses—a space for unfiltered stories, deep connections, and conversations that feel like soul-care.It's the ultimate girls-only huddle where we let our hair down—literally and emotionally. From DIY bangs gone wrong to salon therapy sessions, this table is all about the magic, mayhem, and memories tied to our tresses.Expect heart-to-hearts, laughter that echoes, and stories that stick. It's more than just hair—it's healing, history, and a whole lot of sass.

location.address: 3275, 1st Floor, 12th Main Rd, HAL 2nd Stage, Appareddipalya, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

organizer.name: HighTable
organizer.description: HighTable is a unique social experience where you get to dine with 4-10 people and engage in meaningful conversations. Our tables create the perfect setting to expand your social circle, and build real connections. If you love good conversations with like-minded people, HighTable is for you!

name: Oota & Aata with Sabha BLR
description: Oota & Aata is an intimate, hyper-local event series that invites people to pause, gather, and play like we used to — back in the day.A curated experience set in Sabha inspired by balmy Bangalore’s late afternoons, games your ajji loved paired with comforting tea-time snacks inviting a slower kind of joy.Oota Aata Edition 1Oota & Aata invites you to explore a range of traditional board games that may stir up a childhood memory or pique your curiosity to learn something new!Created by Roll the Dice, the games accessible to participants double as an archive rooted in culture and yesteryear nostalgia.Recreate the memory of a childhood home where slow weekend evenings were spent in playful exploration with loved ones, as you choose from one of the games like Alaguli Mane/Pallanguzhi, Pagade, Aadu Huli/ Tiger & Goat to explore.The event will also feature snack platters inspired by authentic South Indian tea-time snacks like vadais, Mangalore buns, kuzhipaniyarams and ambient music to elevate the experience. Gather your game-night crew, a friend or come solo for an evening of playful (could get competitive) fun and discovery!About SabhaSabha is imagined as a cultural space housed in a meticulously restored 160-year-old CVS Sabha school, part of the RBANM's Educational Charities legacy. Envisioned as a hub for the arts, ideas, and community, Sabha is a place where heritage meets contemporary expression.About Roll the DiceRoll the dice dedicated to reinventing the experience of playing traditional Indian board games. These games are most enjoyable and beneficial when played by people across generations, offering memory boosts, sharper thinking, relaxation, and improved cognitive skills.

location.address: No.44/A, Kamaraj Rd, Bharati Nagar, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: No One Told Me How to Be a Man
description: No One Told Me How to Be a Man is a first-of-its-kind offline gathering designed for men who are done pretending they’ve got it all figured out.. It’s not therapy. It’s not a workshop. And no one’s going to ask you to “open up” if you don’t want to.It’s just a room full of guys who get it—who’ve also felt lost, burnt out, unsure of who they are outside of work or relationships, or just plain tired of pretending to have it all together.We’ll talk about the stuff that doesn’t usually come up—pressure, failure, identity, and what it actually means to be a man right now. You can speak, or just listen. You’ll leave feeling a little less alone, and maybe even a little lighter.No fixing. No judgement. Just real talk, in a space we’ve all needed—but never had.👥 What to Expect🧩 The Unsaid Wall – An anonymous reflection activity to break the ice and realize: you're not alone.🎙️ Story Seeds – A space where we share true, lived moments—not motivational talks. Just honest, grounded experiences.💬 The Real Talk Round – A free-flowing conversation where you can speak if you want, or just sit and take it in.🧠 Leave With Less Weight – This isn’t a space to be “fixed.” It’s a space to be human. You’ll walk out feeling seen, maybe even lighter.☕ No awkward endings – We wrap with  music, and hangout time—because sometimes the best conversations happen after the "main part" is over.💥 What’s Special?This isn’t another self-help circle. It’s a brave space for men to show up as they are—mess and all.You won’t be lectured. There’s no “guru” here. Just stories, silence, laughter, and raw honesty.It’s rare. Most of us have never been in a room where it’s okay to not have it together. That changes now.

location.address: 21/1, Church Rd, Kanakapura, Basavanagudi, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560004, India

name: The Malabar Feast by Gautam Krishnankutty
description: As our next pop-up, we bring to you The Malabar Feast by chef Gautam KrishnankuttyA childhood spent stirring pots, a career spent running kitchens - somewhere in between, Chef Gautam discovered where he truly belongs. From the crisp snap of Neypathal to the slow warmth of mutta roast, this is Kannur, plated just as he remembers it. Menu:Small Starter Plate : Selection of Chamanthis with crispy fried sardines, shredded pepper pork and boiled tapioca. Course 1 - NEYPATHAL WITH LEELA’S CHICKEN CURRY - Crispy rice flour fried flatbread paired with my grandmothers Malabar coconut chicken curry Course 2 - VELAPPAM WITH CHEMEEN ULLI THEEYAL  - Appams paired with a prawn curry of baby onions, roasted coconut, spices and tamarind. Course 3 - MALABAR PAROTA WITH MUTTA ROAST - Crispy flaky Malabar parota with egg curry of roasted tomato, onion and byadgi chillis Course 4 - DEVISADANAM MUTTON BIRYANI - Malabar style mutton biryani served with ginger and mustard pachadi, date chutney and pappadam. Dessert: Porrichi Nendra Pazham - Fried Kerala banana with rum molasses & vanilla ice-creamTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked.Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. In case you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Beers, Bros & Banter
description: Let’s face it—men don't always get the space to vent or just be. Between work, relationships, and being “the strong one,” it’s easy to feel like you’re carrying the weight of the world solo. This table is here to change that.Beers, Bros & Banter is for the guys who need a break from the hustle. It’s where you can crack open a cold one, share some laughs, and talk about life—no judgment, just a bunch of dudes looking for a good time and real conversation.So, if you’re ready to drop the “tough guy” act and swap stories with some new mates, this is your spot. Come for the beer, stay for the banter, and leave with some new bros and good vibes. 🍺

name: Art Uncorked
description: Just good vibes, great conversations & a glass of wine.🍷Ever felt like the art world is too complicated or not meant for you? You're not alone. This table is a gentle introduction to the world of art—what it means, how to appreciate it, and even how it can be part of your life.We’ll chat about everything from what makes a piece special to how you can start exploring art without feeling overwhelmed. No fancy terms, no pressure—just an open space to learn, share, and enjoy.Whether you're a total beginner or just curious, come hang out with like-minded folks, ask questions, and maybe even find a piece of art you love!

name: Peppa Play and Parent Pause
description: We're back with one of your favourites - a cozy art café for parents and a fun filled Peppe Pig playdate for the kids!While your little ones jump in muddy puddles (well, not real ones) and explore a world of Peppa inspired play, you get to unwindwith some art, coffee and conversation.For the parents: A surprise art experience just for you—designed to let you relax, create, and enjoy the process without any expectations. Think of this as a mini retreat for your mind, where you can explore materials, textures and artistic expression in ways you might not think. Trust us- it's going to be a refreshing, hands-on and immersive experience!

location.address: XJ6P+7VC, Kempegowda Service Rd, near Paramahansa Yogananda Road, Domlur I Stage, 1st Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Master Law of Attraction
description: Master Law of Attraction to attain your Ideal Relationship, Success & Health..Learn the key paradoxes of the Law of attraction, understand what's blocking your energy and reset it as you learn to let go of your past and embrace a phenomenal reality as you manifest all your dreams.Come back to feeling driven, motivated as you conquer your dreams for real as we work through the blocks keeping you stuck & help you embrace your true inner power with powerful tools and techniques Hi, I am Urvi Jethwa, I have been practicing law of attraction since 13 years & teaching it since 9 years. I have coached 500+ individuals till date with Manifestation coaching and inner child trauma healing. See you on the 11th May at Dialogues Cafe in Bangalore and lets overcome inner blocks and align our emotional guidance system so we can love ourself and let go off our past.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: New Moon Breathwork: Meet Your Inner Child
description: Reuniting with the Inner ChildAs the moon disappears into the void, we too are invited to empty.To soften. To release.This Conscious Connected Breathwork journey is an invitation to meet the tender, emotional part of you that still holds the imprints of childhood - the Inner Child.Held in the fertile stillness of the dark moon, this session creates space to uncover unmet needs, release stored emotional residue and restore connection between your Inner Child and Adult Self.Together, we’ll explore:What parts of you are still longing to be seen and held?What patterns are you ready to dissolve?What would it feel like to parent yourself with love, patience, and gentleness?With the breath as your guide, you’ll enter the womb of transformation - where the child within is not only heard, but embraced.This is a space to let go of survival-mode patterns and make space for softness, joy and renewal.We’ll close with a gentle meditation and space to share.Please bring yoga mat and anything you need to feel cozy lying down (scarf, eye mask, shawl etc.)About the Facilitator:Maria is an intuitive healer and guide who transitioned from a thriving corporate career to the healing arts. With over 8 years of experience, she weaves Breathwork, Reiki, Tarot, Access Bars, Shadow Constellations, and psychotherapy-inspired methods into deeply grounding and expansive journeys. Her sessions create space for emotional, spiritual and energetic healing - inviting you to drop into your body, regulate your nervous system and return home to yourself.
